concise_definition: n. 奶油, 乳脂; 精华, 最佳部分; v. 使形成奶油状, 击败

definitions.explanation_en: A thick, rich, yellowish-white substance made from the fatty layer of milk, used in cooking, baking, or as a topping.
definitions.explanation_cn: 从牛奶中分离出的浓稠、富含脂肪的淡黄色物质，常用于烹饪、烘焙或作为甜点的浇头。
definitions.example_en: She added a spoonful of heavy cream to her coffee.
definitions.example_cn: 她在咖啡里加了一勺重奶油。

definitions.explanation_en: A smooth, thick cosmetic or medicinal preparation applied to the skin, often for moisturizing or treating conditions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种用于皮肤的光滑浓稠化妆品或药膏，常用于保湿或治疗皮肤问题。
definitions.example_en: He applied a soothing cream to his sunburned skin.
definitions.example_cn: 他把一种舒缓霜涂在晒伤的皮肤上。

definitions.explanation_en: The best or most desirable part of something, often used metaphorically to refer to the most talented or successful individuals in a group.
definitions.explanation_cn: 某事物中最优秀或最理想的部分，常用于比喻群体中最杰出或最有能力的人。
definitions.example_en: Only the cream of the crop were selected for the prestigious scholarship.
definitions.example_cn: 只有最优秀的人才被选中获得这项声望卓著的奖学金。

definitions.explanation_en: To remove the fatty layer (cream) from milk or to cause something to form a creamy texture.
definitions.explanation_cn: 从牛奶中分离出奶油层，或使某物形成奶油状质地。
definitions.example_en: The milk was left to sit so the cream could rise to the top.
definitions.example_cn: 牛奶被静置，以便奶油浮到顶部。

definitions.explanation_en: To defeat someone decisively or thoroughly, especially in a competition or argument.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在竞赛或争论中彻底击败某人。
definitions.example_en: Our team creamed them in the final match, winning 8–1.
definitions.example_cn: 我们在决赛中以8比1大胜对手。

comparison.analysis: “Butter” (黄油) 是由奶油进一步加工制成的固体脂肪，通常经过搅拌和盐渍，质地更硬，用于涂抹或烹饪。而 “cream” 是液态或半液态的乳脂，脂肪含量较低，口感更轻盈，常用于饮品或甜点增稠。
“Lotion” (乳液) 通常比 “cream” 更稀薄、含水量更高，适合油性皮肤或日常保湿；而 “cream” 更浓稠、油脂含量更高，适合干性皮肤或需要强效滋润的场合。两者都是护肤品，但质地和用途有明显区别。
“Essence” (精华) 指某物最核心、最本质的部分，常用于抽象语境（如‘艺术的精华’），而 ‘cream’ 作为‘精华’的比喻用法更偏向于‘最优秀的人或物’，带有社会筛选或等级意味，更具形象性和口语化。
